result.execSummary:
The defendant Robert K. Lafrenier was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency. The previously paid $60.00 deposit has been applied to the Court Appointed Attorney's Fees in the amount of $1292.84.    Attorney Fees to be paid directly to the Waushara Co Clerk of Court for Court Appointed Counsel.  Attorney Fees to be paid within 60 days or set up a payment plan with the Clerk.  Failure to comply will result in contempt procedures being initiated.
Good Time Credit and Huber Privileges granted.

DNA sample to be provided and surcharge assessed.  The uncharged citation (Citation No. R9156420) issued on March 1, 2016 for Fraud - Application/Registration/License with a violation date of March 1, 2016 is also dismissed and read in.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Robert K. Lafrenier

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Posted 467.00 by PayGov-remaining balance to be set up on a PP
Re: Work Release and Good Time Credit - Huber suspended until 6 am 12/26/16, 2 days of Good Time Credit canceled

Case called @ 3:02 p.m. Defendant Robert K. Lafrenier in court, in custody, appears via video.  Scott Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Motion filed by the State to revoke the defendant's huber privileges/good time credit. Defendant does not wish to dispute that a violation had occurred. Statement by DE regarding imposition of penalty - feels that revocation of huber and good time credit is an excessive penalty for the violation. Statement by DA Blader. The Court suspends work release privileges until December 26, 2016 and revokes 2 days of good time credit.
Motion hearing on December 19, 2016 at 03:00 pm.
State's Motion to Revoke Work Release and/or Forfeiture of Good Time Credit
Order for Compensation Re:  Court Appointed Counsel Fees - $1292.84 - Atty Sanders-Brown
records.descr: Order for reimbursement of GAL or Attorney

records.addlTxt: Case Called @ 2:30 PM: Defendant Robert K. Lafrenier in court with attorney Kristina M. Sanders-Brown.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Joint Agreement on resolution recited by ADA.  Def and counsel concur with State's recital.    Defendant advised of potential punishment.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed.  Plea Ct 1 w/o Repeater:  NC  Court accepts plea and enters JOC.  Repeater Component dismissed and 16TR-631 DRI.   Statement by Def:  Requests time to report.  The Court:  45 days WCJ, Report 12/1/2016; GT, Huber, No TS credit, Court Costs - 60 DTP or PP.  DNA Sample and Surcharge ordered by the Court.  Defendant advised of right to expunge DNA record through the Department of Justice.  Appeal Rights Given.  Court Appointed Atty Fees imposed - bill to be submitted by week's end.  State moves for dismissal and read in alleging fraudulent application of license - R9156420.  Appeal Rights Given.
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 25, 2016 at 02:30 pm.

NOT PUT OF RECORD: Defendant Robert K. Lafrenier in court with attorney Kristina M. Sanders-Brown.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Statement by Attorney Sanders-Brown.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 25, 2016 at 02:30 pm.
Status conference on September 27, 2016 at 09:00 am.

NOT PUT OF RECORD: Attorney Kristina M. Sanders-Brown in court, appearing in person.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  STC rescheduled as requested.  Status conference scheduled for September 27, 2016 at 09:00 am.
Status conference on August 2, 2016 at 09:20 am.

NOT PUT OF RECORD: Attorney Kristina M. Sanders-Brown in court, appearing via telephone.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Per Atty Sanders-Brown:  Discovery exchange ongoing and further STC requested.  Per ADA:  Discovery intended to go out in the mail today.  Status conference scheduled for August 2, 2016 at 09:20 am.

Status conference on June 30, 2016 at 10:45 am.

Case called @ 3:52 p.m. Defendant Robert K. Lafrenier in court.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Statement by DA Blader - had previously represented the defendant. Will need to be addressed. DE is requesting an attorney. Statement by DE - requesting court appointed counsel. The Court counsel be appointed forthwith. The Court orders the defendant to make $20 monthly payments toward attorney fees.  Status conference scheduled for June 30, 2016 at 10:45 am.

Pre-trial conference on May 26, 2016 at 09:15 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on June 8, 2016 at 03:30 pm.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician. Complete ID process with the Sheriff's Department.

Case Called @ 2:30 PM:  Defendant Robert K. Lafrenier in court, appearing pro se.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Advised of right of Counsel.  Def waives counsel to allow for PTC.  Court receives waiver of counsel.  NGP entered as to both matters by Court.   PTC and P/S Scheduled - NOH Given.  Court enters Riverside Ruling in favor of the State and probable cause finding as to each count alleged within the complaint.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 26, 2016 at 09:15 am.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 8, 2016 at 03:30 pm.
